newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian police arrest alleged child smuggling gang.
newsitem.headline: Italian police arrest alleged child smuggling gang.

text.p: Italian police have arrested eight people suspected of clandestinely importing and selling Somali children, state RAI television reported.
It said the eight, seven Somalis and one Italian, were accused of selling the children for prices ranging from 30 to 50 million lire ($18,000 to 30,000).
The news agency ANSA quoted an unnamed investigator as saying the "most optimistic hypothesis is that they were sold clandestinely for adoption. But that is being checked."
RAI said the children were bought from poor villages in Somalia and then brought into Italy by ship hidden in the boots of cars. Most were then sold on abroad.

The television reported that the ring had catalogues containing photographs of the children, whose ages ranged from six to 12 years old. One of those arrested was a lawyer well known in Rome's Somali community.
